text: Gu Fuzhen, an accomplished Qing dynasty painter, was celebrated for his refined figure and landscape  in the same scenes. This fan painting shows a quiet garden where scholars converse in a rustic pavilion, framed by blossoming plum trees, pine, and ornamental rocks. The delicate brushwork and subtle colors balance elegance with natural vitality, evoking the ideal of cultivated leisure. Gu’s work reflects the literati, or scholar-artist, tradition, emphasizing harmony between human activity and the seasonal landscape. The fan’s intimate format heightens its poetic charm, transforming a daily object into a contemplative vision of friendship, scholarship, and the timeless rhythm of nature’s cycles.
title: Scholar in his Creek Side Retreat
